group.title: Topic A (gr)
group.instructions: When group level = 3, we want to see the Topic A (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. This is the current behavior and what is desired.

page.title: Topic A (PG)
page.instructions: When group level = page, we don't want to see the Topic A (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. The last level of group title, e.g., Topic A (gr), is redundant. To achieve this will necessitate a change in what is displayed.

group.title: Topic B (gr)
group.instructions: When group level = 3, we want to see the Topic B (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. This is the current behavior and what is desired.

page.title: Topic B (pg)
page.instructions: When group level = page, we don't want to see the Topic B (gr) in the navigation bar and the breadcrumb. The last level of group title, e.g., Topic B (gr), is redundant. To achieve this will necessitate a change in what is displayed.

sign_in.pgtitle: Login to the Password Policy Formalization Study
sign_in.no_account: Please enter your username below. If you are a new user, please create a new account.
sign_in.error_text: That username does not exist. Please re-enter your username.

sign_up.name_taken: This name is not available - please choose a different name.
sign_up.name_invalid: Name must be only letters and numbers
sign_up.instructions:
A username must consist of only letters and numbers.
If you forget this username, your account and any saved responses cannot be recovered. Only a scrambled version is ever stored in order to protect your identity.
This application does not use passwords. Click here to go to the general comments page with next= set appropriately!

policies_for_review.instructions: Please select a policy from below. An image of the policy will open in a separate window; the questionnaire for this study will be displayed in the this window. Your responses are automatically saved.

questionnaire.invalid_popup_text: Complete responses now? Select 'Fix' to complete your responses. Select 'Move on' to leave this page.
questionnaire.clone_warning_text: The option you just selected will remove all subsequent repeated statements with associated responses. Are you sure you want to remove these?
questionnaire.empty_page_message: Congratulations... you don't have to answer any questions on this page!

help.html:
Information on frequently asked questions is provided below. To leave a comment about this application or request someone contact you, please leave a General Comment.

Help topics
  • What will I be doing?
    • What is a policy statement?
    • Out-of-scope topics
  • Tell us what you see
  • What is the objective of this work?
  • Pop-ups and javascript
  • Supported browsers
  • Recommended equipment
Go Back

Information
  • What will I be doing?
You will be asked a series of questions about each of several real-world password policies.
  1. For each question, try to identify the corresponding statement(s) in the password policy that addresses that question.
  2. Select the responses that most closely reflect your understanding of what the policy is stating. Some questions may not be applicable for a particular policy, so select the most appropriate response.
What is a password policy statement?
Password policy statements typically refer to directions for users about creating, communicating, storing and changing passwords, in addition to the consequences of failing to authenticate. There are typically four types of  statements that direct the user how to comply with the policy:
  • what the user "must" do
  • what the user "must not" do
  • what the user "should" do
  • what the user "should not" do
This effort is directed towards password policy statements for general (non-privileged) user accounts.
There are a number of topics that are out of scope for this effort and questions are not included to inquire about these types of statements:
  • Passphrases and SSH keys
  • Password guidelines for administrators, privileged accounts and superusers
  • Vague statements, such as 'Passwords should be memorable', are out of scope of the current effort

  • Tell us what you see..
In a policy..
Each page of questions contains one or more questions for a given topic. Each page also contains a comments section at the bottom for any additional information that may be pertinent to the topic(s) addressed on that page.

More generally...
For a comment about this application, a technical issue, or other observation, please leave us a General Comment. Your feedback will be emailed to a member of this research project. If you want a response and you provide your contact information, you will be contacted.
  • What is the objective of this work?
NIST will compile participants' responses and use them to discern how users interpret password policy statements. By analyzing the responses of numerous participants, NIST intends to identify policy statement wording that is clear and unambiguous and that which is not. NIST intends to use the results to develop a password "grammar" that organizations could use to write clearer password policies. Further, single and combinations of policy statements can then be isolated and analyzed for usability and security characteristics. The ultimate goal is to provide policy developers with guidelines to reduce user frustration and improve compliance while improving system security. 
  • Pop-ups and javascript
To operate effectively, this application requires that your browser have pop-ups and javascript enabled for this site. See the next section for information on enabling these features for each supported browser.
  • These browsers are supported by this application. 
(Please report technical issues through the General Comment page.)
    • Internet Explorer
    • Firefox
    • Chrome
    • Safari


Go Back

demographics_survey.submit_text: Please fill out all the data - to make changes, select 'Go Back', to proceed to the study click OK

completion_page.review_all_completed: All policy review questions have been completed. You may review and edit any responses, including any comments before submission. Please use the 'Go Back' button or the navigation menu to the left to return to the questions.
completion_page.submit_all_completed: You may submit your review of this policy at any time by selecting the 'Submit' button, however, once you submit a review, you will no longer be able to modify your responses.
completion_page.review_need_responses: You have not completed every question in the review. Sections containing incomplete responses are shown in the red font in the left navigation menu. Please use the 'Go Back' button or the left navigation menu to return to the sections that need responses.
completion_page.submit_need_responses: You may submit your review of this policy at any time, however, once submitted you will no longer be able to edit or modify your responses.

question.text: What is the nature of your comment?

Your comment will be emailed to a memeber of this research project.

Your comments are anonymous unless you choose to identify yourself. If you want someone to contact you, please provide your contact information.
